triples.name: Graph isomorphism
triples.relevance: The paper proposes isomorphism checking as the core technique for recognizing non-isomorphic graphs to enable symmetry reduction.

triples.name: Symmetry reduction
triples.relevance: The paper shows how isomorphism checking can be used as an effective technique for symmetry reduction in graph-based state spaces.

triples.name: Hash function
triples.relevance: The paper uses element-based graph certificate mappings to create hash keys for graphs, enabling efficient heuristic identification of isomorphic graphs.

triples.name: Graph theory
triples.relevance: Graph theory provides the mathematical foundation for understanding graph isomorphism and the structure of graphs being analyzed.

triples.name: State space
triples.relevance: The paper addresses symmetry reduction in graph-based state spaces, which is a key computational model in computer science.
